oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photoreactivity of donor-acceptor ethenes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, AK
HOTA, PK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: trans->cis photoisomerization
excited-states
fluorescence
stilbenes
derivatives
rhodopsin
fulgide
analogs
solvent
vision
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: While 3-(4-nitrophenyl ethenyl-E)-N-H indole is photochemically stable, and shows dramatically red-shifted solvatochromic fluorescence emission (lambda(em) 642 nm with lambda(ex) 405 nm in acetonitrile), the corresponding p-aminophenyl derivative, 3-(4-amino phenyl ethenyl-E)-N-H indole undergoes photocyclodehydrogenation yielding a benzocarbazole photoproduct together with a moderately red-shifted fluorescence emission (lambda(em) 404/414 nm with lambda(ex) 323 nm in acetonitrile).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION B-ORGANIC CHEMISTRY INCLUDING MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY, 42(9), 2048-2053
